DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if the ElectroFluidGraph(tm) (EFG) impedance analyzer is comparable to a predicate device in measuring human body composition.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Study for Bioelectrical Impedance Device to Measure Human Body Composition
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to determine if the ElectroFluidGraph(tm) (EFG) impedance analyzer is comparable to a predicate device in measuring human body composition under normal patient conditions. Specifically, the goal of this study is to compare impedance measurements (R and Xc) determined by using each bioelectrical impedance device and the estimated body compositional estimates [total body water (TBW); fat-free mass (FFM); and fat mass (FM)] calculated by using the same prediction equation (models) as the predicate device.
